title: Save Snapchat Conversations: Chats, Photos, and Videos

steps.title: Tap the chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the chat icon. This is the speech bubble at the bottom of the screen, to the left of the camera icon. You won't be able to save a chat that you've already opened and closed before, unless you have chat deletion set to 24 hours .

steps.title: Tap a chat.
steps.content: Tap a chat. This will open the chat conversation.

steps.title: Tap the text you want to save.
steps.content: Tap the text you want to save. The background will turn gray, and the phrase "Saved" should pop up on the left side of the chat. [1] X Research source Alternatively, tap and hold the chat. Then, tap Save in Chat . You can save both the recipient's chats and your own chats.

steps.title: View your saved chat by re-opening the conversation any time.
steps.content: View your saved chat by re-opening the conversation any time. Your saved chat will appear at the top of the chat window, and will stay there unless you unsave it. To unsave a chat, tap the chat again, or tap and hold the chat, and then tap Unsave in Chat .

steps.title: With the photo or video Snap open, tap the options menu button.
steps.content: With the photo or video Snap open, tap the options menu button. This is the icon with three vertical circles in the top-right of the Snap. [2] X Research source This method saves a Snap sent to you. You can also delete Snaps you’ve sent , even before the other person has seen!

steps.title: Tap Save in Chat.
steps.content: Tap Save in Chat . This will save the Snap in your chat with that individual. [3] X Research source You can only save photo Snaps if their timer is set to no limit and video Snaps if they're set to loop .

steps.title: Find the chat you want to edit.
steps.content: Find the chat you want to edit. For one-on-one chats, you can change the deletion settings from after viewing to 24 hours after viewing . This gives you more time to look at your conversation. Locate the person in either the chat list or the search menu.

steps.title: Tap and hold the chat.
steps.content: Tap and hold the chat. This will open their options menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Chat and Notification Settings.
steps.content: Tap Chat and Notification Settings . This will open a new menu. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete Chats….
steps.content: Tap Delete Chats… . You can find this underneath Pin Conversation . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap 24 Hours after Viewing.
steps.content: Tap 24 Hours after Viewing . There will be a note in the chat saying that you changed this setting. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This confirms your setting change.

steps.title: Tap the chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the chat icon. This is the speech bubble at the bottom of the screen, to the left of the camera icon. You won't be able to screenshot a Snap that you've already opened and closed before, unless the replay option is present. Screenshotting a Snap will notify the user . To save Snaps without notifying , you'll need to take a picture of the Snap with a separate device.

steps.title: Tap the Snap you wish to screenshot.
steps.content: Tap the Snap you wish to screenshot. This will open the snap, and you will have 1 to 10 seconds to take a screenshot of the Snap before it expires. If the Snap is set to “no limit,” there won’t be a time limit. You can replay a Snap once by tapping and holding the expired snap. If you quit the Snapchat app or wait too long, you won’t be able to replay the snap.

steps.title: Press your phone's screenshot button combination.
steps.content: Press your phone's screenshot button combination. This will take a screenshot of the Snap you're currently viewing. Your contact will receive a notification that you just took a screenshot. Note: This will notify the other person that you took a screenshot. For an iPhone , hold down the Sleep/Wake and Home buttons at the same time and release them. You will hear a camera shutter and see a screen flash. [8] X Research source For iPhones without a Home button, press Sleep/Wake and Volume Up . [9] X Research source For most Android phones, press the Power/Lock and Volume Down buttons simultaneously. [10] X Research source On some Android phones, you may need to press the Power/Lock and Home buttons. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Open your phone's image gallery.
steps.content: Open your phone's image gallery. Your Snap will be saved in your default folder for screenshots. If you're using an iPhone, you can find the screenshot in your Screenshots album in Photos, as well as your Camera Roll . Taking a screenshot of a Snap will not remove the time indicator in the upper-right corner of the snap.

steps.title: Take a Snap.
steps.content: Take a Snap. Tap the "Capture" icon at the bottom of your screen to snap a photo, or hold it down to record video.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This is the downward-pointing arrow icon in the lower-left corner of your screen. [12] X Research source The saved Snap will appear in your Memories . See the Snap by clicking the two-rectangle icon on the camera screen. The Snap will also be in your phone’s photo gallery if you have it set to save to both. To save Snaps to Memories and your device's gallery, go to Profile > Settings > Memories > Save Button . Select the option that saves to both locations. [13] X Research source
